title: Honoring Reverend Dr. Johnny Ray Youngblood upon the occasion of his 50th Anniversary in Divine Ministry
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION honoring Reverend Dr. Johnny Ray Youngblood upon
the occasion of his 50th Anniversary in Divine Ministry

WHEREAS, The character and richness of religious and community  life  in
this  noble Empire State is nourished and fulfilled through the faithful
concern and selfless devotion of those who would commit  their  energies
and purpose to the ministry of others; and
  WHEREAS. It is the sense of this Legislative Body to bring full recog-
nition  and just tribute to those individuals who distinguish themselves
and the ministry through their unremitting commitment and preeminence of
service; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to honor  Reverend  Dr.
Johnny  Ray  Youngblood  upon  the  occasion  of his 50th Anniversary in
Divine Ministry on February 2-3, 2011, at Mount Pisgah Baptist Church in
Brooklyn, New York; and
  WHEREAS, The Reverend Dr. Johnny  Ray  Youngblood,  Senior  Pastor  of
Mount  Pisgah  Baptist  Church,  has  fostered the growth of the congre-
gations and the inception of community programs; and
  WHEREAS, Born in New Orleans, Louisiana,  Johnny  Ray  Youngblood  was
only  12  years old when, at an area conference, the United Metropolitan
Spiritual Churches of Christ awarded him a preaching license; he  earned
his  B.A. degree in 1970 from Dillard University, and later received his
Master of Divinity degree from Colgate-Rochester Theological Seminary in
1973; in 1990, he went on to earn his Doctorate of Ministry from  United
Theological  Seminary  in  Dayton, Ohio, as well as receive his Honorary
Master of Divinity degree from Boston University in 1993; and
  WHEREAS, In June of 2009,  The  Reverend  Dr.  Johnny  Ray  Youngblood
retired  as  Senior  Pastor  of the St. Paul Community Baptist Church of
East New York, Brooklyn, after 35 years of  service;  in  2001,  he  was
called  to  serve in the same capacity at Mount Pisgah Baptist Church in
Bedford Stuyvesant, a role he was honored to take on in memory of one of
his mentors, the late Reverend George H. Murray; Dr. Youngblood  contin-
ues to serve as Executive Pastor of this congregation; and
  WHEREAS,  The Reverend Dr. Johnny Ray Youngblood is one of the leading
theologians of his time; his commitment to the call for spiritual  heal-
ing,  racial  parity, social justice, and economic equity for all people
has garnered him national recognition as  a  prophet,  national  leader,
public advocate, motivator, writer, and teacher; and
  WHEREAS, Recognized on the national level as a result of his work with
East  Brooklyn Congregations, an affiliate of the Industrial Areas Foun-
dation, Reverend Dr. Johnny  Ray  Youngblood  spearheaded  the  Nehemiah
Housing Project which has constructed approximately 2,900 owner-occupied
single  family homes in several devastated Brooklyn communities; he also
serves as a national spokesman for the group; and
  WHEREAS, The subject of the 1993 book entitled, UPON  THIS  ROCK:  THE
MIRACLES  OF  A BLACK CHURCH, Reverend Dr. Johnny Ray Youngblood is also
featured in several articles in prominent  magazines,  including  COMMON
QUEST,  THE  THE NEW YORKER, MIRABELLA, DETAILS, EMERGE, and ESSENCE; he
has also been the subject of news journal programs on ABC's "20/20," the
NBC "Nightly News," CBS "Sunday Morning News," Fox  5's  "McCreary  Live
Report," and the "Charlie Rose Show"; and
  WHEREAS, In addition, Reverend Dr. Johnny Ray Youngblood was called by
the  Board  of Mt. Pisgah Church in Brooklyn to assist in the stabiliza-
tion and recovery of the Church, which included restoring the Mt. Pisgah
Christian Academy, since renamed the George Henry Murray Academy; he was
voted Senior Pastor of the Church on May 26, 2002; and

  WHEREAS, Reverend Dr. Johnny Ray Youngblood is  the  father  of  three
sons,  Joel Ray, Jason Royce, and Johnny Jenell; he is the loving grand-
father of six grandchildren, Donnalyn, Joshua, Jalen,  Jordyn,  Jasmine,
and Nicholas; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when a person
of such noble aims and accomplishments is brought to our attention it is
appropriate to publicly and jubilantly proclaim and commend  that  indi-
vidual for the edification of others; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Reverend Dr. Johnny Ray Youngblood upon the occasion of  his  50th
Anniversary in Divine Ministry; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  Reverend  Dr.  Johnny  Ray Youngblood, Mount Pisgah Baptist
Church, Brooklyn, New York.
